intro: Ligusticum modestum, commonly known as lesser lovage, is a perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its aromatic leaves and roots have been used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Ligusticum modestum is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in partial shade.
